answers.answer: I'm presuming they have checked to make sure she's not pregnant?  If she is, this could be a sign of preeclampsia, which, if left untreated, could be fatal for both mother and baby.It does sound like maybe a severe allergic reaction - have they tried giving her an antihistamine type medication such as benadryl?I would also request they double check her liver - sometimes swelling can be a sign of liver failure.I hope she starts to feel better soon!

question: My sis in law is in the hospital, severe swelling...she is 46 with no prior health issues.  She has pulmonary edema, really from her head to her feet.  SWELLED... She was bit by an army?? ant a couple of weeks ago, and the next day she broke out in a rash from head to toe COVERED> with this red rash.  Then she developed the edema.  Cat scan is unremarkable, but she is losing protein in her urine.  She's talking and laughing in the hospital, but looks swollen. Blood work has been ok, ruled out heart disease, kidney disease and they are going to do a cat scan on her lungs to see if the edema started there... I still think it all goes back to the Army Ant??? bite.  No temp and pressure is normal.  Breathing is crackly and she still has fluid around her lungs although they have taken a liter out.   She's desperate to find out what's wrong... she is on no medications.Has anyone ever seen anything like this...
title: Please help
